intro: Roeslinia tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled roeslinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinct, angular stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a mild, aromatic scent. Roeslinia tetragona is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
